summary: This document is a series of emails from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio to various recipients, primarily alleging massive, ongoing securities fraud involving Knight Capital/KCG/Virtu Financial (NITE/VIRT). Dilorio accuses the SEC, Jefferies, and others of criminal obstruction, covering up illegal naked short selling and money laundering through OTC markets, and facilitating fraudulent mergers and accounting schemes.

persons.name: Christopher J. Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the emails, making detailed allegations of securities fraud, accounting fraud, money laundering, and SEC obstruction related to Knight Capital, KCG, and Virtu Financial.

persons.name: Cifu
persons.context: Repeatedly mentioned as the CEO of Virtu Financial (VIRT) who allegedly stopped disclosing OTC market share volumes, oversaw fraudulent accounting, and was involved in the KCG merger.

persons.name: Handler
persons.context: Referred to as having a corrupt, criminal relationship with the SEC/SDNY. Allegedly a major beneficiary of frauds involving Knight/KCG/Virtu and involved in the Neiman Marcus/Kamensky case.

persons.name: Dan Kamensky
persons.context: Subject of a joint SEC/SDNY complaint. Dilorio believes exculpatory evidence is being withheld and that Kamensky's case is connected to the corrupt SEC/Handler relationship.

persons.name: Jay Clayton
persons.context: Former SEC Chairman accused of not recusing himself from conflicts related to Sullivan & Cromwell and NITE/VIRT, and of facilitating fraud.

persons.name: Blostein
persons.context: A sell-side analyst at Goldman Sachs covering NITE/VIRT. Dilorio challenges him to model OTC market share volumes and accuses him of omitting material facts.

persons.name: Janey
persons.role: SEC Official (likely in Office of the Whistleblower)
persons.context: Recipient of many emails. Accused by Dilorio of failing to produce the full whistleblower record and being part of the obstruction to protect NITE/VIRT.

persons.name: Hoecker
persons.context: Recipient of emails. Accused by Dilorio of being corrupt and precluded from involvement due to the need for an independent investigation of Clayton.

persons.name: Judge Cave
persons.context: A judge whom Dilorio contacts regarding the Kamensky case and the alleged corrupt relationship between the SEC and Handler/Jefferies.

persons.name: Judge Jones
persons.context: A judge whom Dilorio addresses, providing "irrefutable proof" of a corrupt SEC relationship with Handler/Jefferies.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: A judge whom Dilorio applauds for reproof of the SDNY and urges to look at the Dan Kamensky case.

persons.name: Daniel Coleman
persons.context: Quoted in a 2017 KCG SEC filing regarding low market volatility in Q1 2017.

persons.name: Glenn Hutchins
persons.role: Co-founder of Silver Lake, former Blackstone
persons.context: Described as a friend of Jay Clayton, involved with Blackstone, bought SunGard, and co-founded North Island, a top shareholder in NITE/VIRT.

persons.name: Greifeld
persons.context: Former NASDAQ CEO, former director of Automated Securities Clearance Ltd (sold to SunGard), and co-founder of North Island with Hutchins.

persons.name: Adena Friedman
persons.context: Current NASDAQ CEO who signed off on NASDAQ's acquisition of the BRUT ECN from SunGard.

persons.name: Jared Fishman
persons.context: A Sullivan & Cromwell colleague of Jay Clayton accused of playing a key role in keeping NITE/VIRT operational.

persons.name: Norberg
persons.context: Accused of creating extraordinary reasons for denying Dilorio's whistleblower award, including claiming SEC investigators never saw his information.

persons.name: Berger
persons.context: The individual with whom Dilorio filed his 2013 Knight TCR (Tip, Complaint, or Referral).

persons.name: Joshie Sason
persons.context: Linked to Hanover/Magna and involved in fraudulent note assignments and money laundering shells like CGFIA, IMDS, NewLead.

persons.name: Justin Keener
persons.context: Detailed in Dilorio's 2013 TCR for illegal activity; barred by FINRA as a "Bad Actor"; later involved with Blink Charging/New Image Concepts.

persons.name: Richard Best
persons.context: Brought a FINRA complaint against Brown Brothers Harriman related to money laundering, which Dilorio claims is based on his information.

persons.name: Repetto
persons.context: A sell-side analyst mentioned in the context of being questioned about threats or promises from Cifu/Handler and having BUY ratings on NITE/VIRT.

persons.name: Fannon
persons.context: A sell-side analyst mentioned alongside Repetto, likely at Jefferies, to be questioned about the NITE/VIRT situation.

persons.name: Schwarzman
persons.context: Mentioned as someone Glenn Hutchins worked with at Blackstone prior to founding Silver Lake.

connections.description: Dilorio is a whistleblower corresponding extensively with SEC official Janey, accusing Janey of failing to produce records and being part of obstruction.
Dilorio alleges a corrupt, criminal relationship exists between Handler/Jefferies and the SEC/SDNY, facilitating fraud and obstructing investigations.
Portrayed as collaborators in the alleged fraudulent VIRT/KCG merger and ongoing accounting fraud to protect NITE/VIRT.
Colleagues at Sullivan & Cromwell; Dilorio alleges Fishman played a key role in keeping NITE/VIRT running, and Clayton had conflicts.
Co-founders of North Island, which became a top shareholder in NITE/VIRT. Connected through SunGard and NASDAQ transactions.
Dilorio is advocating for Kamensky, believing his information and evidence of SEC/Handler corruption could exonerate Kamensky.
Both are described as "bag men" involved in fraudulent schemes and money laundering through OTC shells, based on Dilorio's TCRs.

events.title: Knight Capital "Glitch"
events.description: The so-called "glitch" where Knight Capital suffered massive losses, which Dilorio alleges was a cover-up for insolvency due to illegal naked shorting and the first of many cover-ups.

events.title: VIRT/KCG Merger Closing
events.description: The closing of the $1.4 billion all-cash merger between Virtu Financial and KCG Holdings. Dilorio alleges it was fraudulent, based on inflated tangible book value and preceded by a $4B+ write-down of naked short fails.

events.title: VIRT Q3 2020 Earnings Call
events.description: Virtu Financial's Q3 2020 earnings call where Dilorio notes no tough questions were asked about balance sheet fraud, tangible book value, or OTC market share volumes.

events.title: Dilorio Contacting Judge Nathan
events.description: Christopher Dilorio emails Judge Nathan applauding her reproof of the SDNY and urging her to look at the Dan Kamensky case, alleging SEC/SDNY corruption.

events.title: SEC Complaint Against SeeThroughEquity
events.description: The SEC brought a complaint against SeeThroughEquity, LLC for pump-and-dump schemes, which Dilorio links to promotions of Net Element (NETE).

events.title: FINRA Bars Justin Keener/JMJ
events.description: FINRA barred Justin Keener/JMJ as a "Bad Actor" for failing to comply with information requests related to suspicious transactions and money laundering.

keyFacts: The whistleblower, Christopher J. Dilorio, alleges a massive, ongoing fraud where Knight Capital/KCG/Virtu Financial's core business is abusive naked short selling of OTC market shells to facilitate money laundering.

Dilorio accuses the SEC, particularly under Chairman Jay Clayton, of criminal obstruction, actively protecting NITE/VIRT and Handler/Jefferies while denying his whistleblower award and failing to investigate.
The 2017 VIRT/KCG merger is described as fraudulent, with a $4+ billion write-down of "naked short fail" assets just before closing to hide insolvency and inflate the acquisition price.
Dilorio connects the fraud to a wider network including individuals like Glenn Hutchins, former NASDAQ CEO Greifeld, and entities like AQR, Blackstone, and Sullivan & Cromwell.
The emails reference other alleged frauds like Net Element (NETE) and Blink Charging, claiming the SEC also obstructed investigations into these money laundering/transaction laundering schemes.
